DataElement.preferredName: IV Contrast No Allergy Confirmation Prior Administer Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response of Yes or No to indicate that there was confirmation that the patient has no known allergies to contrast agent prior to injection of contrast.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intravenous Contrast Agent No Hypersensitivity Confirmation Prior Administer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel._Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue._The non-affirmative response to a question._A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized._Having been established or verified._Earlier in time or order._To dispense, apply, or tender something to another, such as administering a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (in-tra-VEE-nus) IV. Within a blood vessel.:Substances used in radiography that allow visualization of certain tissues.

Concepts.definition: Into or within a vein. Intravenous usually refers to a way of giving a drug or other substance through a needle or tube inserted into a vein.

Substances administered during imaging procedures that allows delineation of internal structures. Contrast agents appear opaque due to the difference in absorption of X-rays or other electromagnetic waves and surrounding tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.:A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:Having been established or verified.:Earlier in time or order.:To dispense, apply, or tender something to another, such as administering a medicine.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
To dispense, apply, or tender something to another, such as administering a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016
